description: It's very rare that I would review a fast food restaurant, but my mother and I were so satisfied with our visit that we had to give it five stars! Yet alone a drive through visit! I had the Wakey Bakey Hash. So good! Hash browns, cheese, seasoning, and egg. I wish it weren't Limited Edition! I'm so sad it's only available for a short amount of time. My food was a little bit salty, but that's okay because the customer service was just amazing and that really topped off our experience. Our food was fresh and hot. The wonderful staff were so friendly and welcoming. We will probably be coming back soon!
author: Catalina G.

description:
Drive through line took 20 minutes but I was jones'ing for some of the strangely good but gross tacos and eggrolls =/

I get home to find the tacos upside down and salsa splattered all over the bag.  Worse, there was no eggroll sauce.  

I wanted to SCREAM!

No bueno!
author: Seung Eun C.

description:
WOW did i just deal with the worst retail worker in my entire life ? At a jack in the box? 
My coworker had ordered a spicy sriracha curly fry burger and when we got our order we were checked out by a super sweet lady in a "Jack" Apron around 5:20AM with brown hair , it took like 15minutes for us to get our order of a burger(not the combo) and a shake...way too long for our taste but no big deal, we had just gotten off our long shifts and we wanted to eat and sleep.
We get our food and leave..not even a couple hundred feet after exiting , my coworker notices they got the order wrong , it was the regular sriracha burger (i had no idea there was a difference ) . We went back to the drivethrough and told the lady who checked us out and her expression changed so quickly. She grabbed the bag, looked inside and SNAPPED at us that we ordered the sriracha burger. We kept telling her we didn't (if i had the receipt i would've even shown her but she failed to give me that..) she literally ARGUED with us. My coworker and I were calm while she was raising her voice at us and telling us what we did order and what we didn't. I was so taken aback to see someone's attitude change from completely sweet to a major b&tch. My mouth was open in disbelief the entire time , she was moving her head and hands with attitude on top of it all. We literally had to clarify with her that we weren't upset and we just wanted our order, that's all..then she took a deep breath, turned around and slammed the bag on the counter... The guy who took our order came around when she walked off and asked us if she gave us the sriracha curly fry burger , even her own coworker clarified that she had messed up..give or take another 15 and she comes back with our order with a smile. Talk about some major bipolar disorder. We've all worked retail and i can only imagine the amount of terrible customers they have to deal with but jesus , that was BY FAR the worst experience ive ever had at any retail/food place to this day. Already taking steps to contact the manager
author: Maddy F.

description: The should give more training to drive thru staffs to memorize the menu and get them enough sleep lol. No master what I say to them over the machine they would replay:"Sorry, I don't understand what you saying."
author: Justin Z.

description: Greasy and tired. I don't know how else to describe this spot. Lots of hurting folks outside begging for food/money. Parking lot is a disaster.
author: JonJon W.

description:
It's been awhile since I've been here now I know why I don't go here or to any fast food if I'm going to go to fast-food I think I'll just stick to Burger King which is right close to where I go to the doctors  at least you can have it the way you want it. lol 
Now onto my experience on this day last Friday. I hate to give them a 2-star because there's only two Jack in the Box one on Bayshore and one in Daly City the one in Daly City the people are extremely nice but the one here why do you always have to wait for your food so long? there's always a long line in the Drive-Thru there's always a long line inside then how do you fuck up your order a burger is a burger? this is why I don't like fast food.
But since I was on my way home from the movies and I was in a cab we went to the drive-thru took 20 minutes that's ridiculous and it was only 3 cars ahead of us but at least I could say they gave me the correct food I do like their fries,but I don't like their buns I wouldn't even call it a bun I have no idea what the hell it was? The burger was mah. 
I know you're a fast food place but Step Up Your Service be a little bit more personal don't have a attitude if you don't like working there then go somewhere else but I think you're making what 15 bucks an hour to flip hamburgers. Right?
Thanks for reading my Jack in the Box review.
  ~Lizzie~
author: Lizzie G.

description: Peice of hair in the egg country scambler plate, ask to speak to a manger they didn't connect me with a manager, she didn't give me a receipt. I ask for ketchup they gave me taco sauce, call them they hang up on me, lady being so disrespectful and rude saying come back and you get the same plate for dinner, I mention it's inconvenient to come back. Not wanting to eat this for dinner, lady repeated you can get this for dinner she repeated it 5x (aggressive and loud) and hung up on me, the food makes me feel nauseous!
author: Mindy C.

description: The food here is terrible! Dry bread on my sourdough jack. Meat was dry and old. I threw it away. I was so upset. The cooks are playing around instead of making hot food.
author: Sean V.

description: Hmm, I think I will give this location a solid score of only two. Well, the food wasn't all that great. It was just average and at the very least it was satisfying. I don't really like the service much. Slow movement at the drive in. I can only say that this place is just good. Passable for my taste.
author: Jason L.

description: Once again this is a great spot for late nite snaking thier 5 dollar box is bomb and thier curtious and polite I subtract one star cause the drive through is a pain but Friday nights are usually busy
author: Oso O.

description:
For the most part, fast food is "lousy to just okay".  This location has a long time problem with panhandlers, opportunistic thieves hanging (hub caps beware) etc. So I rarely go here. In addition, "Jack" tends to be more expensive than the other guys and you tend to wait longer.  But the new Smokey Cheddar Chicken sandwich prompted me to swing on by.  But, I was really taken aback that the deal I saw on TV ($4.99 meal deal) was $9.00 here.  Sheesh.  $9.00 for a grungy drive through experience. Even so, I ordered the expensive meal: Chicken Sandwich no Bacon.  I think I was on a mission, so fine. 

When I got to the window, they re-read my order as a "burger". So I said "Chicken, no bacon". A sort of irritated and, I would argue, rude, worker said "yeah you got chicken" with a poor attitude. Well....don't call it a Burger, it isn't a burger and guests wouldn't have to ask and double check if you said it right in the first place. Small point in reality, but because fast food places screw up so often and having to drive back sucks, and because getting home to find out that you we given something that you would never eat or order really sucks.....customers will have to double check when you don't call it out correctly.

The sandwich was fine. But I sure have no reason to go back.
author: Karen L.

description:
I love'd the woman who was taking my order over the drive thru speaker, but then someone rudely chimed in without notice which at first startled me and then pissed me off. Once I pulled forward to the drive through window to pay I asked the another employee, "who was that, that talked over the girl in the drive thru". 
"That was Hector, he's a supervisor, he is on break upstairs"
Hector is a blow hard no body, that doesn't know up from down, abusing his "drive thru ""management"" power" to discredit all of his employees. Who I hope is let go in the near future.
author: PBlue ..

description:
JIB is the latest to jump into the cronut clone craze. It's a temporary new item. 

I came to try it just out of curiosity, because it's the only clone that's made to order. So u get them hot, unlike all competitors who serve them cold.

This location is a franchise so they charge $2.99 for 3 (regular JIB owned stores charge $1.99 for 3). No big deal, it's still a reasonable price when considering that most fake cronut imitations charge $5 each.

These are plain (dusted in cinnamon sugar), without any glazing or cream filling (the NY original).

These hot donuts were actually not bad, they're soft exactly like malasadas in Hawaii. But since JIB calls them cronuts, I expected layers inside and a slightly crisp exterior (fresh out of the fryer). It had neither, so I was a bit disappointed. Better described as malasadas with a hole.

I should explain that I seldom rate fast food places above 3 stars (unless something is exceptional). This drive thru location is very clean and service is friendly.
author: Luis C.

description:
They lock their doors 15 minutes before closing the dining room. When asked about it in the drive-thru, they said it was open. "Great! We'll come inside". Get out of the car, go back to the door, and they don't answer.

I understand that lots of restaurants don't want people to come in close to close, but being honest about it would go a long way towards customer satisfaction. Answering a knock on the front door when you're open would also be nice.
author: Victor R.

description:
What happened?

I used to love this location.

Has it taken over by aliens?

What happened to the prices? I thought I was in Norway.
author: BigJohnS F.

description: I ordered egg rolls and cheddar wedges on my way home, waited in line for 20 minutes and asked when ordering twice for sour cream and sweet and sour sauce. And when I got the bag I asked is there sweet and sour and sour cream.... Yes he says frustrated that I asked again... I get home and she enough... Neither one... Can't eat egg rolls without sweet and sour... Can't eat cheddar wedges without sour cream... 14 bucks and 20 minutes in line for nothing... Tried to call and complain but the only number on line is a fax machine... terrible
author: Gordon G.

description:
Once I came here and tried to order the food, but the man standing behind the counter  was very unpleasant and just decide to turn around and leave. Overall, everyone has a bad day once in a while.
I decide to come back, is convenient, fast, and don't like to admit it "I like Jack in the Box". However the same man behind the counter was there again.
I directed myself to him like nothing happened before, I was like, Hey, whats up?
Him; May I take your order?
Me; C'mon, not again.
Him; May I take your order?
Me; Well, if I don't have an option, yes!
He walked away, grabbed a young man and ordered him, "Take his order" and walked away deeper into the kitchen.
I thought that he was extremely rude again, but I continued to serve my drinks. 

He was at the front again and I asked if there is a manager I can speak too? And he replied that the manager was not in for the moment. I noticed his name tag and his name was Hector. 
I went up stairs and started to eat my meal and one of the employees was cleaning the area and I ask her. Hey! What is the name of your manager?
And she answered "Hector".

No more words! You deciede if you want to go there.

PS. This is the same man yelper Diana P. is talking about. So is not only me.
author: Bernard B.

description: Tried the California breakfast burrito and it was surprisingly really good. Lots of guacamole in it. Only issue I have is that the tortilla is too flaky and tends to fall off when eating. The salsa they give with the burrito is a small amount so make sure to ask for 2 or more containers of salsa. Other than that I hope they make this burrito a regular on the menu.
author: Ernesto I.

description: Well Hector seems to the the star in this Jack In The Box I wonder how he became a manager if u need to have really good customer service sense in order to work at a fast food place !! Well merry Xmas to me and getting such a bad attitude from HECTOR who definably need a attitude check , I think he was mad cause he didn't get the day off but oh well. First there was an issue with the customers in from of us then the customs move refusing to continue the order with him. Then we got close to his register and he just ignore the fact that we were waiting for him to take our order all the the sudden he rudely ask us if we were finally ready, we start giving out order and I ask for a large ice coffee which he replied there is only one size , the. He ask me what flavor I ask for hazelnut and he looks at me like I'm a stupid and says that flavor doesn't exist  . Well another very bad experience with Hector !! Just wanted to share
author: Walter A.

description: If you haven't been to Jack In The Box then I recommend that you do so soon. They have a great variety here from their salads to burgers and Mexican food. Whenever I am in I usually get this going to cheeseburger which has a sirloin patty with american cheese and in number of veggies added in. The bakery-style bun is absolutely delicious and a perfect mix for this burger. I also almost always cancer chicken fajita pita. This is absolutely delicious and unique. For the price you cannot go wrong at Jack In The Box. I recommend that you try if you're in the mood for good food and good service.
author: Malcom B.

description: This location gave me food poisoning so severe I had to go to the hospital. I've eaten at other locations and never had a problem. Stay away from this place.
author: Yana P.

description: about a month ago one of the nights I got off of work late, i had to take bayshore home bcuz the freeway ramp was closed. i was hella hungry and knew i'd be passing by this place & i haven't had jack in the crack in a while, so i decided i'd get some food from here. i ordered my food and as I was pulling forward to the window the employee put his hand out telling me to stop before i could reach it. it was hella odd & took a few minutes so i thought to myself, "i hope they ain't being shady & i better not get food poisoning." I was starving & my stomach was growling so i ate my tacos while driving home & couldn't tell if anything was amiss. when i got home i inspected the rest of my food which looked koo, so i ate it. 2 hours later, i went to sleep. then 10 minutes before my alarm went off, nausea and sharp pain in my stomach woke me up. when i used the bathroom i had loose stool & i was having hella stomach cramping & pain. it sucked bcuz i couldn't call in sick anymore bcuz the cut off time just ended 30 mins before I woke up. so i'm never coming here again. i knew i should've told them to give me new food. always trust your gut feeling.
author: Maria Cecilia Z.

description:
Out of all the fast food chains out there, Jack in the Box is one of a kind.  From breakfast being served all day, to jalapeno poppers, the options are limitless.  Let us not forget about the mighty curly fries.  

As far as food and service go, this location is A-OK.  The area is not the best, and you will definitely see druggies lurking around both inside and out of this food establishment late at night.  Stay safe out there.
author: Victor L.

description: Just had a sourdough jack or what was supposed to be a sourdough jack.  Was literally the most disgusting fucking burger I have every had. I had to spit it out. Fuck this place.  They should be shut down   They should not be serving food like this to human beings.  Fuck this place
author: Devin J.

description: I have been snacking on jack for years...... but the crew has clearly lost its way in the last few months. Hate the idea of giving a review...... but the employees at this place just don't care about anything. I want to add a picture of a half eaten sandwich but can't...... I miss Harold. If you grew up in the city you know what I mean......
author: Joseph T.

description: This has got to be the worst Drive through in the entire Jack in the Box franchise history, ever since they got them punjabis taking orders, they always screw up my order or short me of some food. I put up with them not putting napkins on the bag, but cheating you out of food items??? Holy crap, they must be getting paid peanuts I'd they have to steal food to eat....SMH...Never again from this crappy place... BK or Mickey D's will have my business from now on....
author: Daniel A.

description:
Jack here is open 24 hours and serves breakfast all day. small dining area, small parking lot. looks like most orders are drive thrus.

eats: waffle breakfast sammie(3.69) combo 2.30 more, (a ripoff!)
-tasty waffle with strong maple syrup taste.
-fried egg, sausage in middle, salty.
-taste ok but not worth it, overpriced.
dominating taste is the syrup and waffle

crumbs:
-good service...bad value. 2.5 stars
author: Victor G.

description:
OH Jack!

How your employees disappointed me yesterday. I came in with coupons and they acted a dam fool in there and didn't know what they HELL they were doing. I think you should train your staff to know to do process coupons.

On top of that, they gave me 3 different people orders. SMH. Well, this wasn't  a big deal to me because I felt that because of  my pain and suffering I deserved something for free. I just didn't want more tacos. I wanted something SWEET! 

I will be coming back to this but I EXPECT the next time I come the service is better at this one.

Don't tell me that I cant double up on coupons and then when I want in and order you double 3 of my coupons! WTF! ughhh.

TIP-If you can please go to anoher Jack in the Box with better customer Service.
author: Porsche C.

description: Waited in line for 20mins. Then go to old my food women did not speak English. I thought that the older was right finally get back to my car about to drive off my older was wrong there goes my whole fuxxin lunch never again
author: Dam D.

description: I visited this jack in the box for the first time today and I can  assure you I will never return. As I approach the drive through I began to order my food and  the young man on the other end kept repeating my order which was fine but he kept being sarcastic by mocking how I pronounce certain things. I ordered French toast, 3 jalapeño poppers, and a strawberry soda. I was over charged and wasn't given a receipt, I had to ask for butter milk for the jalapeño poppers and syrup for my French toast (good thing I looked) I mean it's only common sense that someone who ordered French toast would want syrup with their order, and if they were trying to cut down on condiments he should've asked. Once I got on the freeway I realize they gave me Hawaiian punch or something like that, it wasn't strawberry  soda and I had no napkins or a fork! to top it off my jalapeño poppers were soggy. I gave this place two starts because the drive through service was quick and the French toast was really good considering it came from a fast food place, but I will not be back there.
author: Danielle J.

description: I just went to buy and I asked for 7 jalapeños the Indian guy was kinda rude so I got the cashier window and he was there so paid $4 I don't mind the money but he charged me for 7 jalapeños and he just gave me 3 so was wrong before I left he said "fuck you" so jack in the box has to look for a nice people  no bull*****....
author: Eduardo M.

description: This place is ghetto, they refuse to honor the 49ers take away promo that jack in the box offers which gives you a free jumbo jack with the purchase of a large fountain drink the day after the 49ers game. Other location like the one on Geary Blvd honored the promo. I have filed a corporate complaint to investor relations and better business bureau regarding this. This is clearly false advertisement and fraud.
author: Chloe W.

description: I asked for two 20 piece nuggets but got two 10 piece  churros. I asked for the nuggets after I found out and they gave them to me. I also asked for two bbq bacon burgers. They gave me 2 bbq bacon chicken sandwiches which I figured out after leaving. . Cmon! Idc anymore and just left after I got the nuggets. Didn't want to waste my time anymore. Only thing they got right was my 3piece egg roll that's it. And the food was alright. Don't waste your time here tho.
author: Manuel H.

description:
We went to drive thru today 6/24/15 @ 7pm. 
Bad experience: after we got our order we were just checking it if it's the right burrito one ASIAN GUY wearing maroon shirt asked sarcastically "what are you guys doing?" So we said were just checking it needless to say they made a mistake last time I went to drive thru also and he laughed obnoxiously.. This is an opinion of 2 people me and my friend witnessed it. I've been a regular to Jack in a box but won't be coming back to this branch w this rude employee!! Since we don't want to keep the line we just left. But if I had the chance I would have complain although it seems like he is the manager.
author: Nina S.

description: Scary, SCARY, S C A R Y neighborhood!!!  The food might be greasy good, but the meth-heads who yell their order out, just as you trigger the worker to ask what you'd like, & the homeless people who get angry (actually ANGRY) if you won't give them money, makes this JITB a "Daytime ONLY" venue!!
author: Reed S.

description: This JITB produced the worst Saturday in recent memory for me. I asked for a breakfast burrito with steak and eggs and they said no can do..only bacon or sausage. I'm like ok...can I just get it with eggs and jalepenos and she says ok and I see on the friggin screen it says no meat or no bacon. So I'm ready to devour this bad boy while driving and Im running late to my class and guess what I find on the third bite...A friggin piece of sausage. I'm a Muslim so pork is a super no-no. I couldn't go back cause I had no time and I had a terrible time focusing in class. On top of it all, I might be going to hell now. If Jack in the Box can apologize to me and send me a gift card, I'll delete this review; But it better be a good apology dammnit.
author: M. H.

description: If I could give this place a 0 I would! Pulled up and ordered my food then when I went to pay for my food they said my bill was a fake and kept the $50. Told me to leave the premises and didn't try to show me the bill at all. WHICH I GOT FROM THE BANK! The cops had to come and show them that it wasn't a fake bill. While I waited they harassed me and told me to just leave because it was fake. They tried to scam me out of my money. BEWARE OF THIS SPOT!!!
author: Cheyenne W.

description: This bitch at the drive thru window was ghetto af. Seriously, this is the busiest spot in this part of the city. Need to take more training classes and some act right. Smh.
author: Missbillie B.

description: I usually work night shift so when I leave work I get fast food from the drive through . Simple . I  put my order in and wait. It's fast food so how could anything possibly go wrong. Ordered regular fries with my order because I hate curly fries for their dryness. Got it wrong both times that I came here. Ordered a monster taco, wasn't in my order both times as well. I do accept that it is my fault because people always tell me to check my  bag before I drive off because once you drive off they can make up any bullshit just to avoid finding a solution. I usually don't check because I know what it feels like to wait and I don't like making people wait that are behind me in line. Moral of the story is spend that 10 seconds to check your bag to make sure they got it all right. I understand we all make mistakes but either I'm unlucky or it's just shitty service they don't even check what they send out
author: Michael C.

description:
I go through many Jack in the Box restaurants. This one on Bayshore, across from Lowe's, is exceptional. I don't write many reviews, but I felt today that I really should. 
     At this Jack in the Box, I have always received good food and great service. It appears to be very well managed. They are always friendly and helpful.
     And, the ladies behind the counter, "! iQue hermosas!!!"
author: Mark A.

description: I don't usually write reviews for fast food chains but I just went to grab a quick bite before dinner. I went into the drive through and Barbie took my order. Gosh, she was very chipper and the most upbeat person I've encountered at a fast food place. Working on Thanksgiving must be rough as it takes away from family time so thank you Barbie being happy and making everyone pass through the drive through happy as well. It definitely puts a smile on everyone's face. :) 5 stars to Barbie!
author: W A.

description: I thought it was cool. I ordered a two tacos and a ultimate cheeseburger. It's not bad for the value aspect. It's Jack in da box. I really feel silly but their commercials actually work on me. I wound up giving away a taco and 50 cents to a homeless dude waiting outside the drivethru.  It's true what they say about this place. There's some ghetto feel to it? Loud music and weird elements thats why i went through the drive through.There's really messed up dudes and females loitering. But just don't make eye contact and just jet. The homeless guy complimented my car and ask me if it was fast? he said he was working on picking himself a car in the future? I don't know bout that cuz he had serious health issues. His hands were swollen and fingers cracked. Sometimes you have to go out and experience all of san francisco. Not just the pretty parts.
author: Selby C.

description:
I've been here several times to get a quick breakfast as I am on the way to school. Oh yeah, I absolutely enjoy eating their curly fries.

- 24 hour drive-thru
- upper level and outdoor seating
Props to these features!

Curly Fries, French Fries and Vanilla Ice Cream Milkshake? Yummy!

Their Bacon, Egg and Cheese Biscuit and Hash Brown Sticks are delicious.

Edit for 10/22/2014:
Their Tacos are delicious and I'm craving for another one. Honestly, I did taste only lettuce, meat and sauce in a tortilla. I like eating tacos but the ones I just had tasted a little bland without the cheese. It really is possible they can do a much better job with the tacos though.

Here's the reasoning for the four stars:
- friendly staff members
- clean restaurant facility
- good service
- parking lot available

I'll definitely be back again when I am in the area and in need of something to munch on.
author: Bennett W.

description: Seriously don't waste your time here. Really the  worst customer service I've ever experienced. My roommates and I went to this location last night and we were ordering seriously after one order of a hamburger he would say "would that complete your order" rudely. Each time we'd order something he would say it rudely - we went to the front of the window and he looked at us all snarky and we were confused, we were just trying to order your food? Then I think he was the manager, he was a short Mexican rude man. He gave us our bags and I pointed saying "can I have some ranch please" and he said "what? You expect me to know what you're saying if you're just pointing at your bag??" I was in shock, I told him " I said can I have ranch please???" And he said "no you didn't. You just pointed and said nothing." So rudely, I was in shock I didn't know what to say. These employees are super rude, don't bother coming here unless you want short tempered employees and stale fries.
author: Diana P.

description: Don't even go here. I literally found a hair ball ( not a piece of hair, a hair ball) in my burger and I called let them no and they hung up in my face. I was already crossing the bay bridge at this point leaving the city so I couldn't go back. This place needs to be shit down. Waste of my time money and very disgusting.
author: Joe C.

description:
They never seem to be able to get an order right and always seem to be able to forget to put half of my order into my bag at the drive through.   

Not worth the effort trying to talk to anyone there as they don't want to correct their errors.
author: Victor Y.

description:
Went here at eleven pm when my brothers and I wanted to try out the munchie meals. Didn't have the munchie meal I wanted. Service wasn't great. Their parking lot is a nightmare. There was a woman doing a pole dance for coins on the lamppost outside, while a family of four casually watched through the windows. Had no straws, or lids. Got the chicken hash brown sandwich. When I  got it home it was too pathetic and sad to even eat. Fries were good and soggy. Would not recommend.

Correction - apparently there were straws and lids but they were next to the window by the pole dancer.
author: Izzy S.

description: Take "ana" out of the drive through window. She plays around to much and takes her sweat ass time. NO BUENO
author: Julian B.

description: They stepped their game way up the inside has been remodeled and the food is prepared with better taste and the bums aren't hanging around as much I like that they put a token lock on the restroom and the overall inside and service is better I only go here every once in awhile for breakfast or a spicy chicken sandwich it's good for a quick cheap bite to eat before working the graveyard shift I've never sat inside to eat but since it looks cleaner I might...not
author: Rashida S.

description: I would have gave this place 5 stars because everyone is so nice here except one person. His name is Hector and he's so called the "manager". I had a terrible experience here and I about got out of the car and rung his neck out because he was such a air filled bone head. I simply asked him question and as I realized he clearly didn't understand what I was asking I re worded what I was asking as he gave me the same response. So I approach it,completely different as we escalated into,an argument because he was just so un educated. His employees had to appologize and explain that this was something usual and he's not really all there. The dude needs to be fired. Everyone else is cool but he gave this place a 1 star.
author: Justin B.

description: This Jack in the box sucks....I ordered a steak breakfast burrito two days in a row and received not a steak burrito but a sausage burrito... Both times! Never go to this jack in the box!!!!   Would give it zero stars if I could!!!!!!!!
author: Kelly L.

description: This place has always been good to me. The staff is laid back and the food is consistent. The drive-thru is 24 hours and can get busy at night. This is the best fast food joint on Bayshore. I love the Jumbo Jack and curly fries!
author: Agent K.

description:
I've been coming to this Jack in the Box for more than 10 years every time I have a fast food craving when I'm at home.  The food's good and the employees' nicely trained. 

Only problem is there's always a bum hanging out at the drive thru exit, when someone open the side door to come in and you can smell the nasty bum smell from inside.
author: Jimmy S.

description: Jack and the Box "Tacos" are nothing more than shredded lettuce...1/4" piece of "American" cheese no choice of cheeses or amount with some kind of unknown meat...I can't describe the quality nor taste & the tortilla shell is deep fried? whether it was fried that morning &/or microwaved after you ordered it -you get what you pay for...
author: Crystal B.

description: Drive thru at night? Good deal. Problem is they consistently mess up your order. Double check your bag before driving off!
author: Jerry S.

description:
I wish there was Jack in the Box in NJ!

They have the 1-2 combo of Burgers and Tacos!! It's like McDonalds and Taco Bell had a baby and names in Jack and put it in a box. Probably the best sandwich is the sourdough Jack because my girlfriend is in love with it. It's pretty much a Beef patty topped with bacon, tomato, Swiss cheese, Mayo-Onion sauce, and ketchup on toasted sourdough bread. Also the taco's are cheap! It's like a dollar a taco which means trouble to my 6 pack underneath my  layers. I also like that hey have curly fries which is definitely better than the normal fast food straight cut fries.
author: Garreth G.

description:
Jack IN the CRACK.. only good when DRUNK and after a night of partying.  If you eat this when you're sober,.. prepare to fill GROSS!

I only do take out/ drive thru.. 

I must do the jalepeno poppers,. SO GOOD *drools* and the bacon cheddar potato wedges drenched in their butter milk sauce,. O M G ! 

Sometimes they charge you 25 cents each, for the butter milk sauce,.. If jack in the box EVER discontinues the buttermilk sauce,. I don't think I will be eating at jack in the box so often,..   

Make sure you check your bag before leaving the window,. sometimes they forget a few items,. but I'm sure everyone does this after leaving any fast food drive thru places =)
author: Chanel L.

description:
Came here after the club to get so some food to eat before I went to bed. Plus that's what ppl do when they go out and drink. 

I ordered the sampler (before they changed whats in it) which is my favorite food at Jack-in-the-Box so I was really excited. But when I got home my excitement turned to sadness because I discovered that my food was very cold. It looked like it was sitting out for a few hours in the back by the fridge.

 I think it was an order for someone else that never got it. This was 100% their fault, I was driving that night and live 5min from this location. My food was inedible and I went to bed starving. Thanks.
author: Louis C.

description:
This was my first time at this location. I was not very impressed. I purchased a chicken sandwich on the dollar menu for a $1.69 and requested extra pickles and onions. The cashier didn't inform me that she was charging me for the pickles (15 cents)When I received the sandwich it only had two pickle slices. I also ask for a cup of water with extra ice. She hands me the cup with water and not with one icecube in the cup. When I asked for some ice, the cashier gave body language such as " rolling eyes" and etc. then mumbled something in Spanish. 
 So while eating my sandwich in the dining room, a customer informed the staff that the restroom needed attention, with tissue and lots of water on the floor. He asked if someone could clean it. The crew leader told him she didn't have any staff available. He then asked if he could have a pair of gloves to clean it and she told him" I don't have any gloves". The customer said I really have to go, so he used the restroom in sub standard conditions. The mop water that they were using to clean the floor was completely black. I wonder if they change the mop water every shift or is it once a day? My experience at this location was very disappointing , especially with the staff.
author: Angelique B.

description: Luv the food! Orders have gotten messed  up a few times while ordering at drive-thru to find out when i got home! Service ok so far! Just check order before leaving or you might be disappointed when your home
author: Susie C.

description:
Once again this is going on my list of "where the locals go in San Francisco."
It is placed here, not because of  the food, but because for years it has been the place that is open between downtown, Bay View-Hunters Point, and the Peninsula.

Technically it is on the border of the areas of Bernal Heights and the Bay View Hunters point on Bayshore Ave.  What that means to Yelpers is that all kinds of people come here, especially on a late Friday or Saturday night.  The line through the drive through often seeps out onto part of the avenue after the clubs have closed.

While waiting in the long line there is of course loud bass music, loud techno, and the smell of what my Grandparents would define as reefer.  (Not that I would know.)

The two stars is due to the long lines and the potential bullshit that might be associated with them during the time of night that I have gone there. As an older individual I try to avoid it.

But if one needs something to put on their stomach after a night of debauchery this place is open.  And if you have dirty windows, no worries, there will be some homeless person willing to wash your windows for a small donation.
author: Joshua C.

description: What a way to ruin my New Years.. I walked my dog all the way down the hill for a sirloin Swiss burger and the inside was closed so we walked through the drive thru and they refused to serve us.  My roommate told me it's because they got robbed by pedestrians in the past.  I don't see how this ridiculous policy could possibly make the folks at the window any safer.  if I intended to rob them I wouldn't care whether the refused to serve me or not; I'd pull out my gat and make them empty the register AND give me my sirloin Swiss.  But, you see, that's not me.  I just wanted to ring in the new year honestly and they sent me into 2014 with my head hanging low.
author: Chris S.

description: This particular JIB is the most expensive Jib I have bin to plus experience the worst drive thru the cashier was talking to other associates in cursing language felt like I'm someplace where I don't wanna be in.  Drive thru order took over 7 mins TOTALLY RIDICULOUS!!!!!
author: moh h.

description:
Hot food always. Sometimes it can take a little while for your food to get to you but it's worth it and really not to long wait times. Robert always seems to get control of situations whenever I see one occur and always has a nice attitude with customers even thought they can be difficult (have seen this first hand) also I do not know her name but she is an older Hispanic women who works the register and might be a lead? She's really awesome. Upstairs is
Nice to eat. 24 hours, can't beat it.
author: Mario K.

description:
Their service is horrible.  They constantly mess up drive thru orders.  Last weekend I ordered 2 sausage croissants and instead they gave me 2 jumbo jacks.  One weekend I ordered a bunch of food and my chicken tenders were missing.  I called to see if they would refund it since I wasn't closeby and they said I would have to come in.  I didn't have the time to go back and I asked for the manager, then the employee hung up on me.  I called back asking for the manager and I was hung up on again.  The employees are rude!

The drive thru is 24 hours, but be prepared to wait if you choose to come on a Friday or Saturday night around 2-3am, right when the nightclubs let out.

This Jack in the Box is getting 2 stars just because I love their food and that's the only thing holding them up.
author: Nicole S.

description:
This is the only Jack in The Box near my house! Hooray for that!  Late night meals and we come here get the cheap stuff.  This location open 24 hours and is never a bad choice.

Anyhow, anytime on weekends starting Friday nights there is always a huge long line to order food. The long line extends on to the street of Bayshore Boulevard. 

The people who work this location do a good job and keep the line moving ASAP.  Like any other fast food place now, certain sauces you need to pay extra if it does not come with the meal you order which sucks.  I remember the old days where you can just ask and boom you get it free 

The food is mediocre, but there food is always super hot and fresh.  Some drive-thru is warm and disgusting.  Tacos are crunch and yummy when it's late night.  

Overall this is a cool spot to hit up if you live near this Jack in The Box, but beware of long lines...  This place does not have any cheap menu because that's what people are used to ordering so they jacked up the prices.  The two tacos are not a buck, nor the chicken sandwich.

**parking**

It's available inside or street

Cash or credit
author: Kenneth Y.

description: This is where I went when my auto window was being replaced. It was standard, nothing special, but the upstairs dining area was nicer than some.
author: Sean B.

description: The new fujita ranch melt burger and sourdough cheesesteak melt burger Taste so good and was nicely wrapped with paper and box when I first bought it in the El Cerrito branch. Got two more here today , was expecting the same perfect one ,turned out to be unexpected. When I got home from drive thru, both burger looked like  disaster. No paper wrapped, only a burger in a box, anyone can imagine what it turned out to be like with a stuff MELT burger! I had to reorganize every pieces before eating it and it was really messy. This does not happen just once....Store manager, please reteach your burger maker a better way of making burger and don't scamp the work, also make sure your paper inventory is always in stock lol.        I know jack in the box may have the best fast food and burger out there, pls don't let this ruin  the reputation.
author: Beb B.

description:
OK... First of all, I had to sit at the stop light for 4 cycles.  The Drive-Thru only allows for 3 cars to be in queue until they are blocking the intersection.  Oh, and this was at 10:30PM... so, don't plan on going through the Drive-Thru.  And since late at night you cannot go into the restaurant, that will make it tricky!  

Also, the biggest deal breaker for me, NO FOUNTAIN DRINKS!!  They only sell CANS!!  Worse than that,, Coke, Diet Coke and Sprite, that is it!

The food is the same as any other Jack.  That is the only reason they get 2 stars.  The lady was nice, but that didn't change the experience.  My suggestion, go across the street.  There is a MCDONALDS!  also open 24 and also with a Drive-Thru!
author: Nathaniel D.

description:
This place did a pretty good remodeling job since the last time I came here, which has been quite a while. Also, the new Lowes store now being across the street probably will give it a little more positive atmosphere.

I always enjoyed their curly fries. Their burger variety is quite good, especially the spicy chicken. Also during this last visit I was impressed by them asking the customers how was the service when we get our order.
author: H K.

description: realized today I didn't receive a receipt for 2 regular cookies and cream shakes and noticed we were overcharged when checking my change today...  The shakes tasted like petroleum instead of ice cream... unfortunately I live in another city and probably won't get a chance to go by and discuss with the management plus the telephone numbers don't work... what's up with that SF?
author: deborah s.

description: What do you expect? Only canned soda the first time I went. Only good thing is they are quick, unlike most.
author: James N.

description: It's below average for a fast food joint. The were out of fanta, the lemonade was warm. Would go to McDonald's next time.
author: Henrik S.

description:
The commonplace begging that often occurs outside the restaurant has moved inside the restaurant.

Now the beggars are picking thru the trash cans inside and begging from customers at the service counter.

When I asked staff why they allow this the response was "we can call the cops but they don't come."
author: Robert M.

description: I Love this place. I have been to this place for so many years that I can't remember how long. I actually just started working near by and I am not such a breakfast eating person so I love that JIB offers all their food all day and night (Great idea). I am reviewing just for these past 7 months and I have to say that the employees are great and I think their morning manager is awesome and not to say their district manager (Mazhar) they both are very nice, and professional. I would totally give them a 5 star except that I don't like feeling uncomfortable after getting my food and being waited for at the exit by panhandlers. I myself am going through a tough time financially at the moment and having panhandlers there waiting does not make me feel good. Sometimes I'll just drive past when I see them standing waiting because I feel bad when I can't give them at least a little bit of my change (which I need to pay parking meters in SF) but when they are not standing there I usually drive in and get some food. I have nothing against the panhandlers except that they don't know how uncomfortable they make some people feel.
author: Jackie G.

description: f yeah j box in the house late night j box run for lifeeee whenever i"m up to that hoodrat shit in the late night am i roll through bumpin shit with my homes
author: erich s.

description:
I used to go to this place once a week late night until they got cheap.

$1.50 for two tacos and super stingy on buttermilk, WTF!?

I always get to-go since the place is super dirty.
author: Danny L.

description:
JACK IN THE BOX RULES.
End of story.  

But this review is not about the drive-thru, the quality of the food, or the fact that it's in the middle of nowhere.

This review about ONE PARTICULAR DRIVE-THRU ATTENDANT.
I'm talking about the 6 foot plus Indian dude who damn near jumps out the little window to hand you your food.  It's super unnerving.  
He's pretty much in my lap in my little Yaris when he hands me my change.
That dude needs to get a clue that I don't mind leaning out a bit to get my delicious 99 cent tacos and my burgers with extra garlic mayo.
Listen up:
It's really uncomfortable when you contort your entire upper half through the little window and are in my face.  No good and quite frightening.  

For that guy alone, I take one star off.
author: Meh M.

description:
The Inside: Smells like my High School Locker Room, which isn't a nostalgic smell like fresh cut grass. It's more of a wet-funk haven't they ever heard of bleach smell. Enough to turn your stomach especially when thinking of food stuffs prepared here.

The Outside: Drive-thru is open 24 hours and the later it is the more activity it draws. Once you leave the drive-thru window there is usually a few people waiting for you asking for your change.

Both times I've eaten here (once at night and once during the day) I've had a "gut feeling" that I wasn't making the best and or safest choice. My gut was right.
author: Bucky K.

description:
Jack in the Box haters can all take a flying leap. Not only does this place have real sirloin (or *tastes* like it) in their breakfast burritos, but they brought back the mozzarella sticks (maybe you didn't know they were ever gone, but believe me, I felt the void when they stupidly took them off their menu for a spell). You know you can't hate on mozzarella sticks when it's 2 am and you're forcing your DD to take you through the drive-thru because in your buzzed mind, you can't live without them (believe me, people, it sometimes feels like that to me). 

And for crying out loud, JITB haters, this place serves breakfast all day! 

In my perfect little utopia that I've created for myself (in my head, of course), the only kinds of bands are indie, Nicholas Cage is banned from making any more movies, and every restaurant serves breakfast all day. That means that I can, at any hour of the day, order my french toast with a side of bacon, and endless amounts of coffee. Well, obviously I can't order that stuff at JITB, but what I'm trying to say here is that they *get* me. They understand. If JITB had skin and hair, we'd be besties.

Every time I walk in and don't use the drive-thru somebody's mopping (translation = this place is at least trying to be clean). And they're super friendly. And one of the ladies who works in there has the most freak out awesomest head of hair. For reals. Go and check it out.

And while you're at it, stop hating on Jack in the Box.
author: Rachel F.

description:
I love all of the low star reviews... HELLO???? it's Jack in the FREAKING box!! Sheesh! 
SB and I go here late at night after we've been doing some drinkin'. 
I mean really, it's open 24 hours and is a DRIVE through, after a few cocktails the food tastes pretty good and is cheap.
You need a little "Food Buffer" (TM Cait Z.) in your stomach to soak up all of the booze, this is key to not feeling like crap the next day.
Listen peoples it's all about the Chicken Strip Kids meal ok? And the Cheese Cake is pretty good too.
Bon appetit!!!!

**Minus one star for the shady mc shaderkins hanging out in the parking lot.
author: Catty C.

description: Jack in the Box is OK, It is not better than MCD. It is very close by to my house so it is very convenient for me.This is one of the other Fast food places that is open 24 hours like MCD. I only come here if i don't want MCD late at night. The only thing i get here is OREO SHAKE!! IT IS VERY GOOD! and curly fries. Everything else is alright, but i rather stick to the mcchickens, double cheeseburgers, and mcnuggets across the street.
author: Daniel L.

description:
They've screwed up my Supreme croissant minus the meat order SO many times. One time, they even said they COULDN'T do a meatless Supreme Croissant but the truth is, the people that were working that time were lazy bastards.

Recently, though my mom and saw they put no meat on the screen, they still put ham and just today, we said no meat but they just put no ham. Suddenly, bacon and ham don't constitute as meat but at different times? My mom complained with her old style sass and we got two new meat less croissants on the house. Damn straight Bayshore Jack in the Box, damn straight. Props to my mom though for having some backbone.

The Daly City on Top of the Hill is LOADS better; at least they've only screwed up and meated up my order ONCE.
author: Lauren L.

description:
Hey, it's fast food!  But after a night of bar hopping, there is nothing like a mess of those crunchy, calorie laden, grease dripping tacos!  With extra sauce, and me being the clutz that I am, drip red sauce on my white shirt.  Also go for the ultimate cheeseburger with onions and get your entire day's supply of calories!

Did I mention the 24 hour drive-thru??  On the way home off the freeway for me!
author: Michael M.

description: I have never had a bad experience at this Jack In the Box. I went to Jack In the Box yesterday, and Moanna was very helpful and polite. Keep up the good work!
author: melissa g.

description: Open late its great, they polished it all up since the lowes was put in so its a little less roachey. Im not quite sure why this Jack in the box decided to go with an art deco exterior, but I do enjoy the second floor dining.  I was told from a very reliable source that the architect that designed this place would leave his underwear in the aisle were the lady employees would see it. He never laid a hand on them but liked them to find his manties, anyways this doesn't really relate to the Jack in the Box, but this one is close to my house, excellent food, and the staff is pretty nice.
author: Atom H.

description:
what ever happen to their dollar menu stuff?? i miss you, please please PLEASE come back. 

this location is convenient for me because i live nearby. 

24/7 drive in = great! nomnomnom

recap, lets bring back the 1$ for 2 tacos and their dollar stuff..
author: Valerie N.

description:
Okay, despite the fact that I can feel my mucuous membranes getting activated in defense of this "foreign object" I'm putting into my body (literally, this is what happened when I had their pumpkin pie milkshake tonight), this particular Jack in the Box has a drive-thru that is open 24 hours, is near my work and practice space, and usually finds me eating at it once every 6 weeks or so.  I can't say the food is good.  It's laden with sugars, corn by-products and is deep fried beyond recognition sometimes.  But every once in a while, a large jalepeno poppers or some blueberry french toast sticks just hit the spot when even El Zocalo is closed and I don't feel like going all the fuck the way down to the main post office cafeteria on Evans St. 

It's fast food.  They pay their employees shit.  They even killed a bunch of people with e.coli back in the 90's.  But, moral relativist that I guess I am, I'll still eat there.  Fuck.
author: Ben V.

description: just had a black pepper bacon cheeseburger - really bad!!! i didn't notice any pepper flavor, overdone hamburger and bacon, and dried out bun!!!  oh, and tasteless onion rings!! this is disgraceful and very disappointing !!!
author: suzanne e.

description:
Fast food at 2 AM? Yes :) 
Debit/Credit card accepted :)
Curly fries :)
Egg roll :)
Variety of sandwiches/burger :)
No fish burger??? :(
High cholesterol :(
What can I say, but... great place to get some snack after a wholesome of clubbing :)
author: dannydan d.

description:
Although it's 24 hr. drive-through service is a plus, the downside is you have a dirty palm greeting you at your exit point to spare a change or an extra burger for free (just in case you ordered a bargain 2 for 1 price deal burgers). I would have given it 4 if it weren't that annoyance that greets me "adios" at the end of the drive-through. I've been to this site a few times and each time it's always like that.

If it were possible to find something quick on those late clubbing scenes and you can feed to the grease urge that you get on those late night fiasco's...argh..

The late night DJ here is quite amusing too.. a think he's been here a couple years now, it's been awhile since my last visit, but there is this deep sounding Barry White voice on the other end of the the mic. You hope to get a dark tall maybe middle aged sexy man serving you, instead you get this fat small balding late 50's maybe close to 60's could possibly be Latin or Indian grandpa serving your meal in a bag from the counter window. Not at all what you expect but he is really nice and always greeting you well on your way out. Reminds me of my grand uncles :-) (that's why it deserved another star)...

I have experienced better, Quite often our burgers are just a fresh, but a few times we walk out with not so hot fries, instead just warm so make sure to mention fresh fries! I would come back if I were in the area and had no other choice.
author: Ateh M.

description: Why am I even taking precious time out of my day to pen this review? I do believe Jack in the Box is the bane of my existence. I much prefer McDonalds. Though to Jack and the Box's credit, they do have sausage croissants and I do adore sausage. Scrumptious!
author: Zachariah Q.

description: best fast food for a late night snack and good place for fried foods!
author: Derrick S.

description: This is an exemplary Jack in the Box.  They have a drive-through, a parking lot, and the people who work here are nice, normal, and do a great job putting the food together.  Sure, it's just fast food, but there's still a difference between a sloppy, slapped-together mess that's missing something versus a meal that simply comes quickly.  Case in point, the tacos they make here are consistently plump and stuffed full of lettuce with a decent amount of hot sauce, much unlike the dismal ones from the Union Square Jack in the Box.
author: daphne w.

description: For being open when ur drunk as hell its past 3am and you just need 2 tacos for .99 cents
author: Kim R.

description: There's a drive through, the staff is friendly, and the food is tasty. What more do you want in a fast food place? Their 100% sirloin burger is better than the one I got at a very highly rated yelp place.
author: Manny F.

description: I love your ice cream shakes. They are so THICK and hard to suck. Which then of course means its real ice cream instead of that cheap shit.
author: Elaine H.

description: Spicy chicken sandwiches, $.99 tacos, curly fries, double cheeseburgers, chicken tenders, jalapeno poppers--all fatty, clog-your-arteries, kind of food.  I love it!  Fast, convenient, cheap, and on the way home!
author: Mel P.

description: fastest, open uhhhh all the time! And the workers are generous on ranch n condements .
author: Frank M.

description:
After the clubs, this place is packed @ 2am.
Line out the store onto the street for the drive through.
Food is always fresh, maybe because they're so busy.
Food is great
customer service is great
-1 star for the bums near the exit
author: Joanna L.

description: Nothing like going to Jack-in-the-Crack to get your 99 cent tacos and Jumbo Jack in the middle of the night.  I swear that this place has the longest line for a drive through...it goes out all the way to Bayshore Blvd. I always make sure I lock my doors. This is suppose to be a fast food joint, but the workers are soooo S-L-O-W!!!!
author: hello k.

description:
I know you're a San Francisco snob and the simple idea of Jack in the Box offends your sensibilities. Personally I'm embarrassed when I make the lonely trek here every coupla months when the girlfriend is outta town and it's late. I'd never show up at home with fast food.

But let's be honest. There are few things in life as satisfying as the Jack-in-the-Box taco. I've been eating them for maybe 27 years. They're great; especially when the American cheese wedged in there hasn't quite melted. It's like In and Out. Lick the paper material.

This Jack in the Box is kind of a dump. It scares me to go here. But now and then on the way home from drumming I'll stop by. 

The drive up is always packed so it's get stuck halfway in traffic or wait for someone in the other lane to drive up and cut in front of you. There are always seedy looking types hanging out the parking lot and panhandlers staring with hungry eyes by the pick up window. Once some guy cussed me out and once someone passed out next to the ordering station. You're kind of trapped in the parking lot, can't back out, can't move forward, so lock your doors.

It's a dirty and gross block but the food seems ok for what it is. And the service has gotten better. You know what, it's f'ing Jack in the Box. 

5 stars for the tacos, 2 stars for the location.
author: creige a.

description: Yea this place I only go to when its very late and I sobered up after a long night on Paul Ave with some friends. You have to be desperate to go here late cus bay view area as some of you may know is not the safest place to be late at night. And yes homeless people have tried to come up to my car window for money and food so it is not always a pleasant wait in the drive thru lane!
author: Michael H.

description: Fives because the samoan lady is nice. shes always say "goodmorning" and "have a goodday" to customers. i mean its fast food, who really cares about customer service at the employers point of view. second.... they be hookin it up with the food. swear, compared to the jack in the box on mission/4th & the one in san pablo, they be giving you more food unlike the other jack in the box, i pay 2.79 for some bacon n cheese patato wedges and theres barely anything inside the box. YAY for bayshore jack in the box!
author: A A.
